items.content_html:
Value Prop

We are bringing multi-model choice to GitHub Mobile to accelerate your workflow, whether youâ€™re tackling coding questions, brainstorming ideas, or working on the go.

Expected Outcome

With this update, users would be able to select different models from the Copilot Chat UI on GitHub Mobile to get the best results based on specific use case.
items.title: Support Multi-Models Selection in Copilot Chat on GitHub Mobile [GA]

items.content_html:
Value Prop

Developers can now use the gh-copilot extension to interact with Copilot in the GitHub CLI on the Copilot Free tier.

Expected Outcome

With this update, developers can start using the gh-copilot extension for the GitHub CLI, using their 50 chat messages per month to get suggestions for and explanations of gh, git, and other terminal commands from Copilot. When the quota is hit, users can head to GitHub.com to purchase a Copilot Pro subscription.
items.title: Copilot Free in GitHub CLI [GA]

items.content_html:
Value Prop

The new Copilot Search on docs.github.com transforms how teams interact with GitHub documentation. Copilot Search compiles comprehensive, actionable responses with links to related documentation, helping teams quickly resolve issues, discover tools, and improve their productivity with fewer interruptions.

Expected Outcome

Teams can expect faster issue resolution through direct answers. With less time spent searching and troubleshooting, teams will enhance productivity and reduce dependency on support.
items.title: Copilot Search on GitHub Docs [Public Preview]

items.content_html:
Value Prop

This feature allows Dependabot users to optionally configure a delay for opening a Dependabot PR for a newly updated dependency until a certain amount of time has passed.

Expected Outcome

The cooldown feature helps teams improve security and reduce noise from frequent dependency updates by delaying Dependabot PRs for a configurable period, allowing time for patch releases and stabilizing updates without disrupting project workflows.
items.title: Dependabot supports configuration of a minimum package age before creating a PR [GA]

items.content_html:
Value Prop

We are providing users with the ability to view and understand changes to a project and its items over time with an audit history log. This will allow them to see what changes were made, who made the changes, and when they were changed, allowing them to understand (and if needed, reverse action on) activity such as when an item was moved from Low priority to High priority.

Expected Outcome

An audit history log would give more visibility into how a project and its items change over time, allowing users to track specific changes, understand how project items progress in a project with its custom fields, and reverse an action if it was unintended.
items.title: Audit history for Projects [GA]

items.content_html:
Value Prop

We are building a new way to publish and consume actions that will improve the security of the CI/CD supply chain. Building on top of the OCI distribution specification, actions can now be pushed to GitHub Packages as immutable image versions with familiar semantic versions. The immutable packages and semantic versions bring greater predictability and security to users' workflows.

Expected Outcome

Users consuming actions will be able to reference an immutable package of an action by version, providing better security in their CI/CD supply chain. Over time we will build additional functionality like signing, build attestation, malware scanning, etc. to further improve the security of the supply chain and allow organizations to apply more specific policies. Developers creating Actions will have a fully automated workflow for publishing their actions that follows a natural build, package, and publish model with standard package versioning.

Actions publishers will use a new packaging action and workflow to take their existing actions code and publish it to GitHub Packages. Users consuming actions by version tags will automatically start getting the packaged version of the action after it is published. Those referencing by commit SHA or git branch reference will simply need to switch to an appropriate version.
items.title: GitHub Actions: Immutable Actions Publishing [Public Preview]

items.content_html:
Value Prop

The Pull Request Files Changed page is being improved to provide more context at a glance, reduce distractions with improved filtering options, provide easier acccess to comments, support larger and more complex pull requests, and make the experience more accessible to everyone.

Expected Outcome

These changes will improve the code review experience, while still remaining familiar to existing users. These improvements will make it easier to review changes (especially larger ones), stay on top of conversations, focus on the most relevant changes to you, all of which will help reduce review time, improve code quality, and improve velocity.
items.title: Improved Pull Request Files Changed Page [Public Preview]

items.content_html:
Value Prop

Bun is an all-in-one JavaScript runtime & toolkit designed for speed, complete with a bundler, test runner, and Node.js-compatible package manager. Today, customers cannot use the bun package manager with Dependabot. It's the most upvoted customer request in dependabot-core.

Expected Outcome

This enables customers who use bun to get version updates from Dependabot.
items.title: Dependabot version updates support `bun` package manager - [GA]

items.content_html:
Value Prop

Today, customers cannot use the uv package manager with Dependabot. It's one of the the most upvoted customer requests in dependabot-core.

Expected Outcome

This enables customers who use uv to get version updates from Dependabot.
items.title: Dependabot version updates support `uv` package manager - [GA]

items.content_html:
Value Prop

Docker Compose allows you to define your application's containers as code inside a YAML file you can commit to your source repository. It's one of the most upvoted customer request in dependabot-core. This issue adds Dependabot support for the docker-compose ecosystem.

Today, customers cannot use the docker-compose package manager with Dependabot. It's one of the the most upvoted customer requests in dependabot-core.

Expected Outcome

This enables customers who use docker-compose to get version updates from Dependabot.
items.title: Dependabot version updates support `docker-compose` package manager - [GA]

items.content_html:
Value Prop

Following on the release of Linux arm64 hosted runners, the GitHub-hosted runner portfolio is expanding to include arm64 hosted runners for free in public repositories. These runners will be fully managed by GitHub with a base image containing a foundational set of tools. These runners offer a power efficient compute layer which can increase price to performance ratios, allowing users to optimize compute costs.

Expected Outcome

You can use arm64 runners to refactor your applications to take advantage of the price performance benefits of ARM architecture. You can now run their workloads on Arm-based hardware hosted by GitHub to build and deploy your release assets anywhere Armâ€™s architecture is used. These new runners provide power, performance & sustainability improvements for all your Actions jobs.
items.title: Windows ARM hosted runners for OSS [Preview]

items.content_html:
Value Prop

The goal of this feature is to enhance collaboration and knowledge sharing among users by allowing them to easily share insightful Copilot conversations. By enabling the sharing of Copilot conversations, users can communicate their ideas, decisions, or findings effectively without compromising privacy. This feature aims to increase engagement with Copilot, foster collaborative exploration, and support various use cases for sharing data, ultimately driving adoption and growth.

Expected Outcome

We are implementing this feature to enhance user engagement and collaboration within the Copilot ecosystem. By allowing users to share their Copilot conversations, we aim to:

  • Increase the visibility and utility of Copilot by enabling users to share their productive interactions.
  • Foster a collaborative environment where users can learn from each otherâ€™s experiences and insights.
  • Drive user adoption and growth by leveraging the viral potential of shared conversations, which can attract new users to GitHub.
  • Gather valuable feedback and data on how users interact with shared content, which will inform future iterations and improvements of the feature.
items.title: Share Copilot Chat Conversations [Preview]

items.content_html:
Value Prop

Today, Dependabotâ€™s schedule.interval supports only predefined intervals: daily, weekly, and monthly. Users need a more flexible way to schedule custom Dependabot update frequencies.

Expected Outcome

Introducing support for cron expressions in schedule.interval in the dependabot.yml file will provide a more generic and robust solution, enabling users to define custom schedules that meet their specific needs.
items.title: Enable Cron Expression Support for Dependabot Scheduling [GA]

items.content_html:
Value Prop

A new organization-level configuration option for adding secrets to access private registries will improve coverage for buildless CodeQL scans for Java and C#. Developers will have more confidence in the accuracy of the scans, and false negatives will be further reduced. Organization administrators will be able to easily add these credentials for use across all their repositories at once, reducing time spent on configuration and setup for CodeQL.

Expected Outcome

Coverage and confidence of CodeQL scans will increase with this feature, leading to even better security outcomes and increased peace-of-mind for security managers, with minimal overhead for configuration and management.
items.title: Private Registry Org-Level Configuration for Java & C# for CodeQL [GA]

items.content_html:
Value Prop

EPSS (Exploit Prediction Scoring System) is a data-driven framework that estimates the likelihood of a software vulnerability being exploited in the wild. It helps organizations prioritize patching efforts based on real-world risk.

Expected Outcome

With EPSS scores in Dependabot alerts, customers can expect a new way to prioritize their Dependabot updates based on likelihood of exploitation via EPSS score.
items.title: EPSS Scores for Dependabot Alerts [GA]

items.content_html:
Value Prop

Security overview will include code scanning status information for all repositories within the organization.

Users will see a color coded identification of "green," "yellow," or "red" next to each repository in the organization. These indicators represent the status of the code scanning tool's setup and performance. Customers can access the repository to enhance the tool's performance.

Expected Outcome

The feature will streamline code scanning setup and adoption. When users enable code scanning across an organization at scale, they can identify repositories where a code scanning tool is underperforming or malfunctioning and take corrective measures.
items.title: Code scanning: Status information at the organization level [GA]

items.content_html:
Value Prop

Enterprise repository properties allows for the management of custom repository properties across your entire enterprise, allowing teams to apply consistent metadata across all of their repos.

Expected Outcome

With enterprise repository properties, enterprises have a way to share consistent properties across all of their organization without having to manually synchronize properties and deal with duplication. This gives administrators a common way to describe their repositories, empowering consistent application of rules and search parameters.
items.title: Enterprise Governance: Custom repo properties for enterprise [GA]

items.content_html:
Value Prop

Enterprise repository policies, allows enterprise and organizations administrators to control key repository lifecycle events. This allows for targeting of policy to manage repository creations, deletions, transfers, visibility changes and names either for all repositories or more granularly with custom property targeting.

Expected Outcome

By using enterprise repository policies enterprises and organizations can enforce guardrails to ensure new repos can be created meeting their organizational standards and ensure existing repositories are prevented from making accidental changes. This ensures your private repositories are not made accidentally public or deleted, keeping your repositories more secure.
items.title: Enterprise Governance: Repository policy rules

items.content_html:
Value Prop

Developers can now interact with Copilot for free in GitHub Mobile.

Expected Outcome

With this update, developers can start using Copilot Chat in Mobile right away and access to 2,000 code completions and 50 chat messages per month. When the quota is hit, users can purchase a Copilot Pro subscription directly in the iOS version of GitHub Mobile, or in the Google Play Store for the Android version of GitHub Mobile.
items.title: Copilot Free in GitHub Mobile

items.content_html:
Value Prop

We want to make it easier to share and sync item information across projects. This will make it easier to keep items and their metadata up to date and remove the need for manual updates and edits.

Expected Outcome

By helping keep information up-to-date across multiple projects, teams can rely on a single source of truth where critical details remain consistent, easy to find, and free from manual effort.
items.title: Custom Fields across Projects [GA]
